HETEROGENEOUS GAS LIQUID AND GAS SOLID MASS TRANSFER, CHEMICAL REACTIONS AND RELATED MULTIPHASE PROCESSES PLAY A CRUCIAL ROLE IN DETERMINING THE CHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND RADIATIVE TRANSFER PROPERTIES OF BOTH THE TROPOSPHERE AND THE STRATOSPHERE. ATMOSPHERIC CHEMICAL AND RADIATIVE TRANSFER MODELS DESIGNED TO EVALUATE CURRENT AND PREDICT FUTURE AIR QUALITY, STRATOSPHERIC OZONE ABUNDANCE, AND CLIMATE ALL REQUIRE A WIDE RANGE OF HIGH QUALITY HETEROGENEOUS MULTIPHASE CHEMICAL KINETIC AND THERMODYNAMIC PARAMETERS TO PRODUCE ACCURATE RESULTS. IN ADDITION, THE SUCCESSFUL DESIGN AND ANALYSIS OF BOTH LABORATORY SIMULATIONS AND FIELD MEASUREMENTS OF ATMOSPHERIC CHEMISTRY PROCESSES USUALLY REQUIRE RELIABLE KNOWLEDGE OF HETEROGENEOUS PROCESS PARAMETERS. THE PROPOSAL SEEKS FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE PIS ROLE AS CHAIR OF THE NASA PANELS HETEROGENEOUS PROCESSES SUB-COMMITTEE, WITH THE LEAD RESPONSIBILITY TO UPDATE OR ADD EVALUATIONS OF CRITICAL HETEROGENEOUS KINETIC AND THERMODYNAMIC HENRYS LAW SOLUBILITY PROCESSES FOR THE PLANNED 20142015 DATA EVALUATION AND TO LAY THE GROUNDWORK FOR SUBSEQUENT REPORTS.

doc.ContractDescription: ADD MONTHLY SUPPLY PURCHASE REPORTING REQUIREMENT.

THE PRESENT PROJECT PROPOSAL DEALS WITH THE FORMATION AND TRANSFORMATION OF METASTABLE PHASES SOLIDIFIED FROM UNDERCOOLED METALLIC MELTS. WE PROPOSE TO STUDY THE INFLUENCE OF CONVECTION ON PHASE SELECTION IN COMMERCIALLY-IMPORTANT PERITECTIC ALLOYS IN AN EFFORT TO CONTROL MICROSTRUCTURAL EVOLUTION AND SUBSEQUENT MATERIAL PROPERTIES. WE WILL UTILIZE THE ABILITY OF THE MSL-EML FACILITY TO OBTAIN DIFFERENT LEVELS OF ELECTOMAGNETICALLY INDUCED CONVECTION IN REACTIVE METALLIC SAMPLES TO STUDY HOW FLUID FLOW INFLUENCES NUCLEATION BY MONITORING THE INCUBATION TIME BETWEEN FORMATION OF THE METASTABLE PHASE AND SUBSEQUENT TRANSFORMATION TO THE STABLE PHASE DURING RAPID SOLIDIFICATION. THE INVESTIGATIONS WILL BE FOCUSED ON SYSTEMS WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR PRIMARY METASTABLE BCC PHASE SOLIDIFICATION AND SUBSEQUENT CONVERSION TO STABLE FCC PHASE SUCH AS TI-AI BASED ALLOYS AND MIXTURES OF FE WITH NI, CO, PT OR PD. THE METHODOLOGY OF THE PROJECT IS CHARACTERIZED BY THE INTERPLAY BETWEEN EXPERIMENTS AND MODELING OF FLUID FLOW INCLUDING ITS EFFECT ON NUCLEATION AND GROWTH. THIS PROPOSAL WILL ADDRESS THE ELIPS PROGRAMME KEY QUESTIONS WHAT IS THE INFLUENCE OF CONVECTION ON THE FORMATION OF DIFFERENT MICROSTRUCTURES IN ALLOYS? AND WHAT IS THE INFLUENCE OF GRAVITY ON THE TIME AND LENGTH SCALES OF NUCLEATION AND GROWTH? FROM ESA AO-2009.

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF NASA GODDARD SPACE FLIGHT CENTER (GSFC) HAS A NEED TO OBTAIN SUPPORT IN ACHIEVING THE GOALS OF THE SPACE GEODESY PROJECT (SGP). THE GOALS OF THIS ACTIVITY ARE RELATED TO THE STUDY OF THE SHAPE OF THE EARTH AND HOW IT ROTATES. THIS EFFORT WILL BE A FOLLOW-ON TO NASA GSFC CONTRACT NNG10HP00C WITH MASSACHUSETTS INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (MIT)/HAYSTACK OBSERVATORY (HO) FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT FOR THE STATE-OF-THE-ART NEXT GENERATION VERY LONG BASELINE INTERFEROMETRY (VLBI) SYSTEMS IN SUPPORT OF THE NASA SGP. UNDER THIS CONTRACT EFFORT MIT HAYSTACK OBSERVATORY SHALL PROVIDE CONSTRUCTION AND INSTALLATION OF THE SIGNAL CHAINS FOR THREE NEXT GENERATION GEODETIC VLBI ANTENNAS AND VALIDATION OF THE COMPLETED SYSTEMS; OPERATIONS SUPPORT IN THE FORM OF CORRELATION OF GEODETIC VLBI DATA, OPERATION OF THE WESTFORD ANTENNA, AND ENGINEERING SUPPORT FOR THE NASA GEODETIC NETWORK; AND CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT OF THE NEXT GENERATION GEODETIC VLBI SYSTEMS. THE HO SHALL PROVIDE THE PERSONNEL, MATERIALS, FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT NECESSARY TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO NASA GSFC IN ACHIEVING THE GOALS OF THE SGP. THE SCOPE OF THIS EFFORT IS LIMITED TO FIVE SPECIFIC AREAS (CALLED TASKS): 1. BUILDING VLBI GLOBAL OBSERVING SYSTEMS (VGOS) 2. VGOS SYSTEM VALIDATION 3. OPERATIONS AND SUSTAINING ENGINEERING 4. FORWARD LOOKING DEVELOPMENT 5. PROJECT MANAGEMENT

doc.ContractDescription: OUR RESEARCH PROGRAM FOCUSES ON THE MEASUREMENT AND MODELING OF VACUUM ULTRAVIOLET AND UV MOLECULAR PHOTOABSORPTION CROSS SECTIONS WITH THE HIGHEST PRACTICAL RESOLUTION AND ACCURACY. IT IS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT CURRENT EFFORTS TO INTERPRET, MODEL, AND UNDERSTAND OBSERVATIONS OF PLANETARY ATMOSPHERES. WE PROPOSE TO COMPLETE ONGOING MEASUREMENT AND MODELING EFFORTS ON MOLECULAR NITROGEN (N2) AND DIATOMIC SULFUR (S2), AND TO SUPPORT NEW PROJECTS ON THE ISOTOPOLOGUES OF CARBON DIOXIDE (CO2) AND MOLECULAR OXYGEN (O2). OUR PROPOSED RESEARCH PROGRAM COMPRISES: N2: (A) THE COMPLETION OF OUR INPUT TO A COMPREHENSIVE PHOTOABSORPTION CROSS SECTION MODEL OF THE 80 TO 100 NM REGION. A PREDICTIVE UNDERSTANDING OF THE N2 PHOTOABSORPTION SPECTRUM SHORTWARD OF 100 NM IS ESSENTIAL FOR INTERPRETATIONS OF OCCULTATION AND AIRGLOW MEASUREMENTS OF THE ATMOSPHERE OF TITAN, DETAILED MODELING OF THE INITIATION OF PHOTOCHEMISTRY IN TITAN'S UPPER ATMOSPHERE, ISOTOPIC FRACTIONATION EFFECTS ON TITAN AND ON MARS, AND PLANNED OCCULTATION OBSERVATIONS OF PLUTO. ANALYSIS OF OUR RECENT HIGH-RESOLUTION LABORATORY MEASUREMENTS, AND INCORPORATION OF THE RESULTS OF THAT ANALYSIS INTO AN EXTENSION OF THE CROSS SECTION MODEL WILL CONCLUDE THIS EFFORT. (B) MEASUREMENT OF THE PHOTOABSORPTION CROSS SECTIONS OF THE LYMAN-BIRGE-HOPFIELD (LBH) BANDS. THE LBH BANDS DOMINATE THE 120 - 200 NM AIRGLOW EMISSIONS FROM TITAN'S UPPER ATMOSPHERE; THE ANALYSIS OF THEIR PROMINENCE HAS LONG BEEN A CENTRAL COMPONENT OF UPPER-ATMOSPHERIC MODELS OF THE N2-RICH ATMOSPHERES IN THE SOLAR SYSTEM (EARTH, TITAN, TRITON, PLUTO). LBH ELECTRON-IMPACT EMISSION CROSS SECTIONS ARE A NECESSARY INGREDIENT IN THE INTERPRETATION OF THE AIRGLOW EMISSIONS. OUR PHOTOABSORPTION RESULTS WILL BE USED TO IMPROVE THE ACCURACY OF THOSE EMISSION CROSS SECTIONS. S2: PHOTOABSORPTION CROSS SECTIONS IN THE 230 TO 315 NM REGION. DIATOMIC SULFUR IS OBSERVED, VIA ITS UV ABSORPTION SIGNATURE, IN THE ATMOSPHERES OF IO AND JUPITER, AND, VIA ITS EMISSION SIGNATURE, IN COMETARY COMAE. ITS PHOTOCHEMISTRY IS A FACTOR IN MODELS OF THE VENUSIAN ATMOSPHERE AND IT IS CONJECTURED TO PLAY A SIGNIFICANT ROLE IN THE PHOTOCHEMISTRY OF HOT JUPITERS. NO MEASUREMENTS OF THE ABSORPTION STRENGTH OF THE KEY S2 BAND SYSTEM IN THE UV HAVE EVER BEEN REPORTED. OUR MEASUREMENT AND MODELING EFFORT WILL ADVANCE KNOWLEDGE OF S2 AND WILL PROVIDE NEEDED INPUT FOR THE INTERPRETATIONS OF SULFUR PHOTOCHEMISTRY IN ATMOSPHERES. CO2 AND O2: PHOTOABSORPTION CROSS SECTIONS OF THE ISOTOPOLOGUES OF CO2 AND O2. THE PHOTODISSOCIATION OF CO2 IN THE ATMOSPHERE OF MARS IS A PRIMARY ENERGY DEPOSITION MECHANISM, INITIATING MARTIAN PHOTOCHEMISTRY. CO2 CROSS SECTIONS MEDIATE THE DEPTH OF PENETRATION OF SOLAR RADIATION, AND ARE ESSENTIAL INGREDIENTS IN MARTIAN PHOTOCHEMICAL MODELS. PRESENT-DAY ISOTOPIC RATIOS IN THE MARTIAN ATMOSPHERE ARE SIGNATURES OF THE LONG-TERM EVOLUTION OF THE ATMOSPHERE AND CLIMATE. ISOTOPIC FRACTIONATION IN THE PHOTODISSOCIATION OF CO2 IS EXPECTED TO STRONGLY INFLUENCE THE 16O/17O/18O COMPOSITION OF THE ATMOSPHERE. WE WILL MEASURE THE CROSS SECTIONS OF THE RELEVANT CO2 ISOTOPOLOGUES FROM THE IONIZATION LIMIT, 90 NM, TO 190 NM, AND EVALUATE THEIR EFFECTS ON MARTIAN ATMOSPHERIC FRACTIONATION. O FRACTIONATION VIA O2 PHOTOLYSIS BY THE STRONG SOLAR LYMAN-ALPHA FEATURE ARE ANTICIPATED TO BE UNUSUALLY HIGH; WE WILL MEASURE THE RELEVANT CROSS SECTIONS AND INCLUDE THEM IN OUR ANALYSIS OF ATMOSPHERIC FRACTIONATION. OUR PROPOSED MEASUREMENTS AND ANALYSES OF THE ISOTOPIC PHOTODISSOCIATION CROSS SECTIONS WILL DIRECTLY SUPPORT TWO UPCOMING NASA MISSIONS FOCUSED ON THE EVOLUTION OF VOLATILES ON MARS.
